newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-TALKS BETWEEN RFU AND ENGLISH CLUBS BREAK DOWN.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-TALKS BETWEEN RFU AND ENGLISH CLUBS BREAK DOWN.

text.p: Talks between the English Rugby Football Union (RFU) and EPRUC, the body representing senior club sides, ground to a halt on Tuesday, raising the prospect of an irreparable split.
Both parties in the long-running dispute said they planned to issue statements later but an RFU spokesman acknowledged the latest round of negotiations had ended "in disagreement".
The failure to find common ground could result in EPRUC, which represents the 24 teams in the first and second divisions of the English league, breaking away from the union.
It could also affect England international matches. EPRUC has already forced the cancellation of two recent England squad sessions by urging players not to attend.
At the centre of the dispute is EPRUC's insistence on a far greater say in running competitions and also demanding an increased share of money stemming from internationals.
